intro: Lapsana capillaris, commonly known as hairy bittercress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by kidney-shaped, hairy seeds. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in waste areas. Lapsana capillaris is characterized by its alternate, heart-shaped leaves and is part of the Brassicaceae family.
